Haan yaar, woh toh maine socha tha, but doston ne bola tha ki direct apply kar le. Ab lag raha hai ki agent se hi karwana chahiye tha. Koi contact hai tere paas?
Ek tha, but pata nahi abhi bhi kaam karta hai ki nahi. I'll check and let you know. Tension mat le, kuch na kuch toh jugaad lag hi jayega. We'll figure something out.
Thanks bro, teri badi meherbani hogi. Agar kuch pata chale toh please jaldi batana. I'm keeping my fingers crossed, hopefully, sab theek ho jayega.
Accha suno, I'm facing some issues with my partner lately. We're constantly misunderstanding each other, and it's leading to unnecessary fights. Any tips on how to improve communication?

Dekho, communication is key, especially in relationships. The first thing you need to do is actively listen. Really try to understand their perspective before jumping to conclusions or getting defensive. It's harder than it sounds, trust me.
Haan, that makes sense. But sometimes, I feel like they're not even trying to understand me. They just hear what they want to hear. How do I address that without starting another argument?

Okay, try using 'I' statements. Instead of saying 'You always do this,' say 'I feel hurt when this happens.' Focus on your feelings and experiences, and frame it as a request for understanding, not an accusation. It diffuses tension.
That's actually really helpful. I've never thought about phrasing it that way. What about when we're both heated? Should we just avoid the conversation altogether until we cool down?

Absolutely! Taking a break is crucial. Agree to revisit the conversation when you're both calmer. Maybe go for a walk, listen to some music, or even just make chai. Clear heads lead to clearer communication. Remember, patience is important.
Oye sunn, tujhe pata hai woh Sharma aunty ke bete ka rishta fix ho gaya? I heard ladki toh badi modern hai, bilkul alag Sharma family ke values se. Kya scene hai yaar, I'm so curious!
Arre baba, mujhe bhi pata chala! Maine suna hai ladki MBA hai aur US mein job karti thi. Sharma aunty ko toh bahu chahiye thi jo ghar sambhale. Ab dekho, kismat ka khel. I wonder kya hoga aage.

Exactly! Sharma aunty toh har waqt traditional values ki baat karti hain. Now she's getting a bahu who probably wears jeans and goes to parties. I can't wait to see the Diwali photos. Full entertainment hoga!
Haan yaar, Diwali toh dhamaka hoga. Mujhe toh lagta hai Sharma aunty apne bete ko bol rahi hongi, 'Beta, zara bahu ko saree pehnao.' But seriously, I hope the girl is happy. Zindagi toh uski hai.
True that. Pyaar se rehna chahiye sabko. But still, I'm dying to know the full story. Pata chala toh mujhe bhi update karna. Chai pe milenge kal, aur gossip karenge detail mein!
Pakka pakka! Kal chai pakki. I'll try to get some inside information from my cousin, woh Sharma aunty ke ghar ke paas rehti hai. Prepare for some spicy details, my friend. This is going to be good.

Accha suno, Navratri is just around the corner! I was thinking, this time, we should have a proper community garba night. What do you guys think? We haven't done anything big in ages, and it'll be a great way to bring everyone together.

Bhabhi ji, that's a fantastic idea! It's been so long since we had a proper Navratri celebration. I'm in! We can book the community hall and get a DJ. What kind of decorations are you planning? Should we get some food stalls too?

Haan, community hall toh pakka book karna hai. Decorations mein, I was thinking traditional marigold garlands and colorful lights. Food stalls definitely! We can have some chaat, jalebi, and maybe even some thandai. It will be like a proper mela. What say?

Perfect! Count me in for helping with the decorations. I know a few people who can get us good deals on the flowers and lights. And my sister makes amazing chaat. I'll ask her if she's willing to set up a stall. This is going to be epic!

Awesome! Let's make a list of things we need to do. We need to send out invitations, arrange for security, and get the music sorted. Also, maybe we can have a small competition for the best dressed? That'll get everyone excited, right?

Bilkul! Best dressed competition is a must! And we should definitely have prizes. I can help with the invitations and getting sponsors for the prizes. This is going to be the best Navratri celebration our community has ever seen! Let’s make a WhatsApp group to coordinate everything.
Arey bhai, Ganesh Chaturthi aa rahi hai, aur main soch raha hoon kya pehnu. Travel blog ke liye photos bhi toh leni hain. Koi desi outfit suggest karo jo comfortable bhi ho.
Haan, I get it! Photos toh badiya aani chahiye. Ek kaam kar, kurta-pajama try kar. Linen ya cotton mein, so that garmi bhi na lage. Aur ek colourful shawl bhi add kar de, festive lagega.
Kurta-pajama toh theek hai, lekin shawl ka idea bhi sahi hai. Warna toh boring lagega. Ab gift ka kya scene hai? Kuch unique sochna hai family aur doston ke liye.
Gift ke liye, try handmade diyas ya Ganesh idols. Aajkal toh eco-friendly options bhi milte hain. Ya phir, agar budget ho toh, traditional sweets ka hamper bhi de sakta hai. Logon ko pasand aayega.
Eco-friendly idols are a great idea! Aur sweets ka hamper bhi sahi hai. Chal, I think I'm sorted. Thanks for the suggestions, yaar! Ab main bhi Ganesh Chaturthi ke liye ready hoon.
Koi baat nahi bhai! Wish you a very Happy Ganesh Chaturthi in advance. Photos badiya dalna blog pe, dekhna hai. Aur haan, modak khana mat bhoolna! Enjoy the festival!

Oye, sunn! New job ka kya scene hai? Interview kaisa gaya, bhai? Tension ho rahi hai, salary negotiation ka scene kaise handle karun? Bata na yaar, kuch tips de de. Gharwale bhi pooch rahe hain, kab party dega.

Arre tension na le! Interview toh clear ho gaya na? Ab salary ki baari hai. Research kar, market rate kya chal raha hai teri profile ke liye. Confidence dikha, par over-the-top bhi mat ban. Apni value bata, bhai.

Haan, research toh kiya hai. Glassdoor pe dekha tha, but mujhe lagta hai woh thoda outdated hai. Mujhe dar hai ki woh log kam offer karenge, aur main reject nahi karna chahta. First job hai na, isliye thoda pressure hai.

Dekh, unko apna expected salary range bata. Thoda high side pe rakh, taki negotiation ka scope rahe. Aur benefits ke baare mein bhi pooch, like health insurance, transport allowance. Yeh sab bhi salary ka part hota hai.
Accha, yeh toh maine socha hi nahi tha! Health insurance aur transport allowance bhi pooch sakta hoon? Mujhe laga tha sirf CTC ke baare mein baat hoti hai. Thanks yaar, yeh toh helpful tip hai!

Haan bhai, sab pooch! Sharma mat. Yeh tera haq hai. Aur agar woh log tujhe kam offer karein, toh politely bol ki tu woh offer consider karega. Unko lagega ki tere paas aur bhi options hain. All the best, bhai! Party toh banti hai!

Oye, sunn! Going to the mandi today for groceries. Need anything specific? Thinking of making maa ke haath ka rajma chawal tonight, but fridge is empty. Tell me quickly, otherwise I'll just grab the usual suspects – pyaaz, tamatar, aloo.

Accha? Rajma chawal sounds amazing! Haan, get some dhaniya and pudina, absolutely necessary. Also, check if they have fresh hari mirchi. And bhai, if you see good baingan, grab some for bharta. Warna, just focus on the rajma ingredients, that's the priority!

Done deal, boss! Dhaniya, pudina, and mirchi on the list. Baingan I'll see. Mandi mein quality unpredictable hoti hai. Will try my best. Anything else, or should I just get the regular dal-chawal fixings too, just in case the rajma plan falls through?

Nahin, rajma is the mission! Full focus. Get some dahi too, to go with it. And maybe a small packet of papad? You know, for that extra crunch. Oh, and check for good lemons for nimbu pani later. Garmi bohot hai yaar.

Okay, dahi, papad, and lemons bhi done. Anything else, oh great food guru? Warna I'm off. The mandi awaits, and I don't want to get stuck in the usual Saturday crowd. Jaldi batao, my auto-rickshaw is already waiting.

Bas bas! That's all. Thanks a ton, yaar. You're a lifesaver. Ab jaldi jao and get the best stuff! And don't forget to bargain with those vendors, okay? They always try to charge extra. And be back soon with the rajma ingredients!

Oye sunn, kya scene hai? Everything okay na? You seem a bit off lately. Office ka pressure zyada hai kya? Bata na, share kar. Sometimes just talking helps, you know? We've been friends forever, koi judgement nahi.

Haan bhai, pata nahi yaar. Just feeling a bit low, I guess. Office toh theek hai, but internally kuch chal raha hai. Like, I'm constantly overthinking things. Sleep bhi proper nahi ho rahi. It's getting frustrating, honestly.

I understand, man. Overthinking is a killer. Listen, have you considered talking to someone professional? Like a therapist or counselor? It's not a big deal, many people do it. Even I thought about it once during my MBA stress.

Therapist? I don't know, yaar. It feels like admitting defeat. Plus, what will people say? 'Dekho, pagal ho gaya'. You know how society is. But yeah, maybe it's something I should seriously think about.

Arre, who cares what people say? It's your mental peace we're talking about. Think of it like going to the doctor for a fever. This is the same thing. I can help you find some resources if you want. No pressure, just an option.

Thanks, bhai. I really appreciate that. Maybe you're right. It's time I prioritize myself. Let me think about it and I'll let you know. Chai pe chalte hai? Thoda relax ho jayega. My treat, for being such a supportive dost.

Accha suno, kal market jaana hai. Ghar mein sab kuch khatam ho gaya hai. Daal, chawal, atta, sab kuch list bana li hai. Tumhe kuch chahiye toh bata do, warna phir baad mein mat bolna 'yeh nahi laya, woh nahi laya'.

Haan haan, mujhe yaad hai. Last time tum bhul gaye the. Ek kaam karo, woh besan bhi le aana, pakode banane ka mann kar raha hai. Aur haan, dhaniya aur pudina mat bhulna, woh toh har sabzi mein dalta hai. List mein likh lo.

Besan, dhaniya, pudina...done. Aur kuch? Warna mein nikal jaunga. Subah subah market jaana, kitna traffic hoga. Upar se woh uncle kitna bhav badhate hain. Bargain karna padega warna poora budget hil jayega.

Ek minute... haan, woh green chillies bhi le aana, teekha khana hai. Aur dekho, agar achhe aam mile toh woh bhi le aana. Aam ka season hai, thoda treat toh banta hai. Baki sab tumhare hisab se dekh lena.

Theek hai, mirchi aur aam bhi done. Ab mein jaa raha hoon. Traffic mein phans gaya toh shaam tak hi aa paunga. Tum ghar ka kaam nipata lena, mein aate hi chai banaunga. Tab tak kuch aur yaad aaya toh message kar dena.
Okay, all the best! Dhyan se jaana. Aur haan, plastic bags mat use karna, apna wala kapde ka bag le jaana. Environment ka bhi sochna hai. Jaldi aana, mujhe bhookh bhi lagi hai. Bye!

Sun yaar, date night ka kya plan hai? I was thinking we could finally watch that new Bollywood flick everyone's raving about. Heard it's got some killer songs and the story is supposed to be pretty good. What do you say?

Hmm, Bollywood theek hai, but I'm a little burned out on the same old masala. Kuch aur dekhte hain? Maybe something international? I saw a trailer for a suspense thriller on OTT, looks properly gripping. We can order in pizza, chill scene.

Arre yaar, suspense thriller date night pe? Thoda zyada serious nahi ho jayega? I was hoping for something light and fun, you know? But pizza sounds amazing! Okay, compromise – Bollywood masala with a slightly different flavour. Comedy?

Comedy chalega! As long as it’s actually funny, and not just those forced jokes, you know? And promise me, no over-the-top drama. Deal? Okay, tell me which comedy you had in mind. I'm checking the reviews right now.

Deal! There's this one, 'Crazy Rishtey', heard it's a laugh riot. It's about a big fat Indian wedding gone completely wrong. Seems perfect for a light-hearted evening. Plus, the songs are already stuck in my head! What do you think?

Okay, 'Crazy Rishtey' it is! Reviews seem decent enough. Big fat Indian wedding gone wrong…sounds like my cousin's shaadi last year! Pizza and comedy it is then. I'm already looking forward to it. See you Saturday, right?

Accha suno, I've finally managed to book those sunset boat ride tickets. Hope you're free this Saturday evening? It's been ages since we did something other than just dinner and a movie. Think you'll like it, very romantic vibes!

Arre wah! That sounds amazing, honestly! Saturday is perfect, I've kept it free. Sunset boat ride, huh? You're turning into a proper Bollywood hero, Meera. Now I'm really looking forward to it. Where are we sailing from?

Hehe, not quite Raj from DDLJ, but I try. It leaves from Gateway of India. I thought the view of the Taj Hotel and the city skyline would be stunning at sunset. Afterwards, maybe we can grab some street food nearby? Chowpatty?

Gateway and Chowpatty? Done! Perfect Mumbai date, একদম! You know me too well. Street food after a fancy boat ride is the perfect combo. Just tell me what time I need to be ready. And should I wear something fancy-shancy or keep it casual?

Casual is good! The boat ride starts at 6:00 PM, so maybe reach Gateway by 5:45 PM? That way we can find parking and all. I'm so excited! This will be a much-needed break from all the office ka drama.
Got it! 5:45 at Gateway. Casual it is. And trust me, I need a break from work too. This sounds like exactly what the doctor ordered. Thanks for planning this, Meera. See you Saturday!
Oye, toh bata na, rooftop restaurant ke liye kya pehnu? First date hai, impression toh jamana hai. Casual toh nahi chalega na? Kuchh stylish but comfortable bhi hona chahiye. Help kar yaar!

Dekh, zyada toh mat soch. Dark jeans ya chinos, with a crisp linen shirt would work well. Maybe roll up the sleeves a bit. Add a nice watch and some loafers. Avoid anything too flashy, keep it classy and understated.
Linen shirt... hmm, garam toh nahi hoga? Mumbai ka weather hai, rooftop pe paseena paseena ho gaya toh game over. Aur loafers theek rahega? Sneakers better nahi hai for a more relaxed vibe?

Arre bhai, linen breathable hota hai. Light color ka le, white ya light blue. Sneakers bhi chalega, but clean white ones, not the ones you wear to the gym. And a light jacket, just in case thand lag jaaye.
Okay, okay. Linen shirt, light color, check. White sneakers, got it. Jacket bhi daal deta hu bag mein. Ab perfume kaunsa lagau? Theek se bata, over nahi hona chahiye. Subtle, but memorable.
Subtle and memorable? Go for something woody with a hint of citrus. A few sprays on the wrists and neck is enough. Confidence is the best perfume, remember that! All the best, bhai!
Sun yaar, I'm so stressed about these exams. My screen time is killing my study schedule. I just can't seem to focus. It's like my phone is glued to my hand. Any tips from your side?
Arre, I feel you! Exam stress is real. What I've started doing is setting app limits. Like, only 2 hours on Insta, max. And I put my phone on 'Do Not Disturb' while studying. Try it, it helps a lot.
Hmm, app limits sounds like a good idea. I'll try that. But what about when I need to look something up for my studies? I end up getting distracted by other things. That’s the main problem.

Okay, so here's what I do: I use my laptop for research, not my phone. And I keep a notebook handy to jot down extra thoughts, so I don't immediately Google them and fall into a rabbit hole. Works like a charm!
Laptop for research, got it! And the notebook idea is genius. I'm definitely going to implement that. Thanks for the tips, really appreciate it! Ab thoda relief mil raha hai, honestly.
Anytime, yaar! We all need to help each other survive these exams. And remember, take breaks! Chai breaks, walk breaks, whatever works for you. All the best! Padhte raho, badhte raho!
Oye, kya scene hai? I was thinking, life mein kuch toh improve karna chahiye. Just feeling a bit stuck, you know? Same routine, same problems. Koi naya challenge toh banta hai, boss!
Haan bhai, I feel you! I was just reading about this new online course on productivity. Maybe that could help us both? Ya phir, we could start going to the gym regularly? Summer is coming, after all.

Gym is a good idea, but I'm so lazy yaar! Online course sounds less painful. Which one were you looking at? Something practical hona chahiye, like coding or digital marketing. Something that can actually pay the bills later.

I was checking out this one on data analytics. It's supposed to be really good, and there's a lot of demand for it. Plus, it's all online, so we can do it at our own pace. Think about it, it could be a game-changer!

Data analytics sounds intense! But okay, let's check it out together. Shaam ko milte hain, chai peete hain, and we can browse the course details. If it's too technical, maybe we can try something else. Deal?
Deal! Chai pakka meri taraf se. And if data analytics doesn't work out, we can always try learning a new language. Spanish, maybe? Imagine ordering tapas in Spain, kitna cool lagega!

Accha suno, weekend aa raha hai. Grocery shopping ka plan hai kya? Ghar pe toh kuch bhi nahi hai, bas Maggie aur bread pada hai. Local market chalenge? Wahan sab kuch fresh milta hai, aur thoda sasta bhi.

Haan, yeh toh sahi hai. Weekend pe market jaana hi padega. Maggie aur bread kab tak chalega? List bana li hai kya? Mujhe bhi dekhna hai, shayad kuch cheezein main bhi add kar doon. Aur haan, bargaining bhi karna hai!

List toh nahi banayi hai abhi tak. Soch rahi thi pahle tumse pooch loon, tumhare hisab se kya kya chahiye. Bargaining toh main kar hi loongi, woh toh mera favourite part hai. Bas thoda jaldi nikalenge, warna bheed bahut ho jaati hai.

Okay, toh phir ek kaam karte hain, main ek rough list bana leti hoon. Tum bhi add kar dena jo bhi yaad aaye. Aur haan, jaldi nikalna is a must! Sunday ko toh bilkul hi nahi jaana, itni bheed hoti hai ki sar chakrane lagta hai.

Perfect! Main bhi ek list start karti hoon. Sunday ko market mein toh jaise Kumbh ka mela laga hota hai. Saturday theek rahega. Aur suno, shopping ke baad golgappe bhi khaayenge, woh uncle bahut mast banate hain!

Done deal! Shopping aur golgappe, Saturday ko. Golgappe toh banta hai, itni mehnat ke baad. Phir ghar aake chai banayenge aur aaram se baith ke gossip karenge. This sounds like a perfect weekend plan, yaar!

Oye sunn, I was reading about gender identity online. It's so different from what we were taught growing up, right? Like, it's not just ladka or ladki anymore. What are your thoughts on all this new stuff? It's kinda mind-blowing, no?

Haan yaar, I know what you mean! It's definitely a shift. Pehle toh bas wohi binary tha, but now there's so much more understanding. I think it's great that people are feeling more comfortable expressing who they really are, even if it takes time for us to fully understand.

Exactly! And it's not just about clothes or how someone looks, hai na? It's about how they feel inside. I saw this documentary about someone who didn't identify with either gender. It really made me think. It's a journey for everyone, I guess.

Bilkul. And we should all be respectful of that journey. It's their life, their identity. We don't have to 'get it' completely to be supportive. Thoda sa empathy dikhana is important. World mein already itni negativity hai, why add to it?

True that. I think educating ourselves is key. I'm trying to be more mindful of the language I use, you know? Avoiding assumptions and all that. It’s a learning process for sure, and I'm glad we can talk about this openly.

Me too! It's good to have friends who are open to these conversations. Change is scary, but it's also necessary. Let's grab some chai and discuss this further. Maybe we can watch that documentary together sometime? It'll be fun!
Oye, kya scene hai? I was thinking, yeh study abroad ka kya plan hai tera? I'm seriously considering it, but thoda dar bhi lag raha hai. Paisa-waisa, visa, sab manage ho payega ki nahi.

Arre, darne ki kya baat hai? Opportunity toh hai! I've been researching universities in Canada. Fees thoda zyada hai, but scholarships bhi toh milte hain na? Let's check together, maybe we can find something suitable for both of us.

Canada? Not bad! But I was thinking more like UK. Culture bhi thoda familiar hai, plus language barrier bhi nahi hoga. But visa ka process kitna complicated hai yaar. I heard it's a total headache. Any idea about that?

Haan, visa toh tricky hai. But we can go to those education consultants, right? They handle all that paperwork. Plus, let's start preparing for IELTS or TOEFL. Achha score toh chahiye hi. We should start studying together, kya bolti hai?

IELTS toh pakka karna padega. Okay, deal! We'll study together. Aur sun, parents ko kaise manayenge? They'll be worried sick if we go so far. Especially my mom, she's already emotional about me leaving for college.

That's the biggest challenge, I know! We'll have to convince them that this is a good investment for our future. We can show them the career prospects and higher salaries after studying abroad. Let's make a presentation for them!
Oye, kya chal raha hai? I was thinking, life mein kuch naya try karna chahiye. I've been feeling stuck lately, you know? Same routine, same old grind. Need to shake things up a bit, bhai.
Haan yaar, I feel you! Main bhi soch raha tha. Office aur ghar bas. Kuch toh karna padega. Maybe we should pick up a new skill together? Online courses are quite trending, heard they are pretty good.

That's a good idea! What kind of skill, though? Coding is too mainstream, right? I was thinking more along the lines of something creative, like photography or maybe even learning an instrument, like guitar.
Guitar would be awesome! Imagine us jamming together. But photography is also good, especially with all the travel we do. Let’s check out some courses this weekend. We can start with a free trial.
Done deal! This weekend we explore options. But also, I've been meaning to get back into fitness. Join kar gym, kya? Summer is coming, and I need to shed some of this lockdown weight, dost.

Perfect! Gym is a great idea. I’ll join too. We can motivate each other. Aur diet bhi control karna padega, sirf gym se nahi hoga. Challenge accepted then, new skills and fitness goals! Let's do this!
Accha suno, I'm thinking of suggesting a coffee and book date this weekend. There's this cute bookstore near my place, 'The Book Nook'. You think that's a good idea for a first date, na?

Haan haan, that sounds lovely! 'The Book Nook' is perfect – cozy vibes, good coffee, and plenty to talk about. Much better than a noisy bar. Go for it! Just make sure they also like books, otherwise it'll be awkward.

Exactly my thought process! I remember him saying he enjoys reading, so fingers crossed. I'll suggest it then. Should I specify a time, or just say 'this weekend'? I don't want to sound too eager, you know?
Relax, ya! Suggest a specific time, like Saturday afternoon around 3 pm. That's casual enough, not too much pressure. Plus, if it goes well, you can always extend it to dinner. Smart, hai na?

Wah, you're a total dating guru! Saturday 3 pm it is. Now, what should I wear? Something casual but cute? I don't want to look like I tried too hard, but also want to make a good impression, obviously.

Definitely casual but cute! Think jeans and a nice top, or a flowy kurta. Something comfortable that you can actually sit and read in. And don't forget a little bit of kajal – always works! All the best, yaar!
